tuv.seg: Religious and secular marriage ceremonies
Searmanais an phósta reiligiúnacha agus saolta

Since the commencement of Part 6 of the Civil Registration Act 2007 in November 2007, to legally marry you require a Marriage Registration Form (MRF) from a Registrar and whoever is solemnising your marriage must be on the Register of Solemnisers

Tar éis theacht i bhfeidhm Chuid 6 den Acht um Chlárú Sibhialta 2007 i Samhain 2007, chun pósadh go dleathach, tá sé de dhíth ort Foirm Chláraithe Pósta (FCP) a fháil ón gCláraitheoir, agus caithfidh cibé duine atá ag sollúnú do phósadh a bheith ar Chlár na Sollúnóirí
The Registrar issues the MRF when you give your 3 month notification to the Registrar
Eisíonn an Cláraitheoir an FCP nuair a thugann tú fógra 3 mhí don Chláraitheoir
If you are intend getting married by religious or secular ceremony, you should approach the authorities of the body concerned for advice on how to proceed
Má tá tú ag pósadh trí shearmanas reiligiúnach nó saolta, ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le húdaráis an comhlacht lena mbaineann, chun comhairle a fháil maidir leis an gceist a bhogadh ar aghaidh
You will be told what requirements that body has in order to get married under their rites
Inseofar duit céard iad na riachtanais atá ag an bhforas ionas gur féidir leat pósadh faoina gcuid deasghnátha
While a marriage ceremony can be performed according to the customs and rites of the body, there are certain requirements that must be met in order for the marriage to be legal

Cé gur féidir searmanas pósta reiligiúnach nó saolta a chur ar bun de réir nósanna agus deasghnátha an fhorais reiligiúnaigh nó saolta, tá riachtanais áirithe ann nach mór a chomhlíonadh ionas go mbeidh an pósadh dlíthiúil
The person solemnising the marriage must be on the Register of Solemnisers (pdf) which is maintained by the General Registrar
Ní mór don té atá ag sollúnú an phósta a bheith ar Chlár na Sollúnóirí (pdf), atá á choinneáil ag an bPríomh-Chláraitheoir
It lists both civil registrars and the members of the various religious and secular bodies who have been nominated by the bodies as solemnisers
Tá liosta ann de na cláraitheoirí sibhialta agus na baill de na forais reiligiúnacha agus saolta éagsúla atá ainmnithe ag na forais mar shollúnóirí
It is available for inspection at your local registration office
Is féidir é a scrúdú ag d'oifig clárúcháin áitiúil
The ceremony must be performed in the presence of two witnesses aged 18 or over
Caithfidh an searmanas tarlú i láthair beirt fhinnéithe atá 18 bliana d'aois nó os a chionn

If you fulfill the 3 months notification requirements and there is no impediment to you getting married, the Registrar will issue you with a Marriage Registration Form (MRF) giving you permission to marry
Má dhéanann tú na riachtanais fógartha 3 mhí a chomhlíonadh agus nach bhfuil aon bhac pósta i gceist, eiseoidh an Cláraitheoir Foirm Chláraithe Pósta (FCP) a thabharfaidh cead pósta duit
You should give the MRF to the person who will be solemnising the marriage in advance of the marriage ceremony
Ba chóir duit an FCP a thabhairt don té a bheidh ag sollúnú an phósta roimh an tsearmanais phósta
Immediately after the marriage ceremony, the MRF should be signed by you and your spouse, the two witnesses and the person who has solemnised the marriage
Díreach tar éis an tsearmanais phósta, caithfidh FCP a beith sínithe agat féin, ag do chéile, ag an mbeirt fhinnéithe agus ag an té a rinne sollúnú ar an bpósadh
The MRF should be returned within one month to a Registrar, for the marriage to be registered
Ba chóir an FCP a sheoladh ar ais chuig Cláraitheoir taobh istigh d'aon mhí amháin, chun go gclárófar an pósadh
It does not have to be returned to the Registrar who issued it
Ní gá é a sheoladh ar ais chuig an gCláraitheoir a d'eisigh é
While the marriage ceremony can be performed according to the customs and rites of the religious or secular body, as part of the ceremony you and your intended spouse must make two declarations:

Cé gur féidir searmanas an phósta a cheiliúradh de réir chustaim agus deasghnátha an fhorais reiligiúnaigh nó saolta, ní mór duit féin agus don té atá tú ag pósadh dhá dhearbhú a dhéanamh le linn an tsearmanais:
• That you do not know of any impediment to the marriage
• Nach bhfuil aon bhac pósta ar eolas agaibh
• That you accept each other as husband and wife
• Go nglacann sibh a chéile mar fhear céile agus bean chéile
The venue for the ceremony is a matter for the body
Is faoin bhforas atá an cinneadh maidir leis an ionad don tsearmanas
According to the legislation the place where the solemnisation takes place must be open to the public
De réir na reachtaíochta, ní mór don áit a bhfuil an sollúnú ar bun a bheith oscailte don phobal
This means that access to the venue for the general public must be unrestricted
Ciallaíonn sé seo nach mór don rochtain ar an ionad don phobal go ginearálta a bheith neamhtheoranta

If either you, your intended spouse, either of the two witness or the solemniser does not have sufficient knowledge of the language in which the ceremony is being held to understand the ceremony, then the services of an interpreter must be provided

Mura bhfuil dóthain tuisceana agat féin, ag an gcéile beartaithe, nó ag ceachtar den bheirt fhinnéithe nó ag an sollúnóir ar an teanga ina bhfuil an searmanas á thionól ionas gur féidir leo an searmanas a thuiscint, caithfear seirbhísí ateangaire a sholáthar
It is your responsibility to provide the services
Is tusa atá freagrach as na seirbhísí a sholáthar
